description.b: The purpose of this Web Interface is to enable end users (application developers, Cloud customers, Cloud providers) to check, visualize and rank the actual performance of Cloud resources against real-world benchmarks targeted at specific application categories. Thus a suitable selection of the most promising resource may be performed.

item.title: Select the weights for the ranking process

description.b: Indicate your preferences with regard to the significance of the examined aspects (in this case cost and performance in the fields “Input weights for average” and “Input weights for cost”). Total weights must add up to 1 (100%). For equal importance use average=0.5 and cost=0.5.

item.title: Select the time period of the results (Start Date, End Date)

description.b: Indicate the time period you are interested in. This may be helpful in case one wants to compare based on a specific time period (e.g. only recent results), to check the evolution of the results in time or in specific cases (e.g. weekend performance).
Indicate (from drop-down lists) for which provider and which service instance you are interested.

item.title: Select test type and relevant workload information

description.b: Indicate the benchmark test for which they are interested (e.g. DB, Mapreduce etc.). Based on each test’s details and setup, more information may be requested, for example for what type of DB (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB etc.) and for what type of workload.

Once the information input is complete, average values are portrayed for the key KPIs of each test, along with the score of the specific offering as indicated by the Service Efficiency metric. Detailed measurements from which these values were extracted are also portrayed.
